history.proof: intros f g n x H. revert f g x H. induction n. - intros. auto. - intros. simpl. shelve.

ctx: intros f g n x H.
exceptions.exn: In environment f, g : R -> R x : R H : forall t : R, f t = g t Unable to unify "Derive_n g 0 x" with "Derive_n f 0 x".

ctx: intros f g n x H.
exceptions.exn: The LHS of IHn (Derive_n _ n _) does not match any subterm of the goal

ctx: intros f g n x H.
exceptions.exn: In environment n : nat IHn : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : R), (forall t : R, f t = g t) -> Derive_n f n x = Derive_n g n x f, g : R -> R x : R H : forall t : R, f t = g t Unable to unify "f ?M2373 = g ?M2373" with "Derive (Derive_n f n) x = Derive (Derive_n g n) x".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (f g : R -> R) (n : nat) (x : R), (forall t : R, f t = g t) -> Derive_n f n x = Derive_n g n x

Premises:
Derive_n = fix Derive_n (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x : R) {struct n} : R := match n with | 0%nat => f x | S n0 => Derive (Derive_n f n0) x end : (R -> R) -> nat -> R -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope R_scope]
f = fun f : family => let (ind, f0, _) := f in f0 : family -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [_ R_scope R_scope] f is a coercion
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
FSetPositive.PositiveSet.E.t = positive : Set
*** [ R : Set ]
Derive_n_ext_loc : forall (f g : R_UniformSpace -> R) (n : nat) (x : R_UniformSpace), locally x (fun t : R_UniformSpace => f t = g t) -> Derive_n f n x = Derive_n g n x
is_derive_div : forall (f g : R -> R) (x df dg : R), is_derive f x df -> is_derive g x dg -> g x <> 0 -> is_derive (fun t : R => f t / g t) x ((df * g x - f x * dg) / g x ^ 2)
Derive_ext_loc : forall (f g : R_UniformSpace -> R) (x : R_UniformSpace), locally x (fun t : R_UniformSpace => f t = g t) -> Derive f x = Derive g x
is_derive_n_unique : forall (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x l : R), is_derive_n f n x l -> Derive_n f n x = l
Derive_div : forall (f g : R -> R) (x : R), ex_derive f x -> ex_derive g x -> g x <> 0 -> Derive (fun y : R => f y / g y) x = (Derive f x * g x - f x * Derive g x) / g x ^ 2
NewtonInt_P5 : forall (f g : R -> R) (l a b : R), Newton_integrable f a b -> Newton_integrable g a b -> Newton_integrable (fun x : R => l * f x + g x) a b
antiderivative = fun (f g : R -> R) (a b : R) => (forall x : R, a <= x <= b -> exists pr : derivable_pt g x, f x = derive_pt g x pr) /\ a <= b : (R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope R_scope R_scope]
Derive_n_correct : forall (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x : R_AbsRing), ex_derive_n f n x -> is_derive_n f n x (Derive_n f n x)
Newton_integrable = fun (f : R -> R) (a b : R) => {g : R -> R | antiderivative f g a b \/ antiderivative f g b a} : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Type Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]
StepFun_P38 : forall (l : Rlist) (a b : R) (f : R -> R), ordered_Rlist l -> pos_Rl l 0 = a -> pos_Rl l (Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l)) = b -> {g : StepFun a b | g b = f b /\ (forall i : nat, (i < Init.Nat.pred (Rlength l))%nat -> constant_D_eq g (co_interval (pos_Rl l i) (pos_Rl l (S i))) (f (pos_Rl l i)))}
derive_pt : forall (f : R -> R) (x : R), derivable_pt f x -> R
Derive_inv : forall (f : R -> R) (x : R), ex_derive f x -> f x <> 0 -> Derive (fun y : R => / f y) x = - Derive f x / f x ^ 2
is_derive_inv : forall (f : R -> R) (x l : R), is_derive f x l -> f x <> 0 -> is_derive (fun y : R => / f y) x (- l / f x ^ 2)
is_derive_n = fun (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x l : R) => match n with | 0%nat => f x = l | S n0 => is_derive (Derive_n f n0) x l end : (R -> R) -> nat -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope R_scope R_scope]
derive_pt_eq_1 : forall (f : R -> R) (x l : R) (pr : derivable_pt f x), derive_pt f x pr = l -> derivable_pt_lim f x l
pr_nu : forall (f : R -> R) (x : R) (pr1 pr2 : derivable_pt f x), derive_pt f x pr1 = derive_pt f x pr2
Derive_correct : forall (f : R_AbsRing -> R_NormedModule) (x : R_AbsRing), ex_derive f x -> is_derive f x (Derive f x)
ex_derive_n = fun (f : R -> R) (n : nat) (x : R_AbsRing) => match n with | 0%nat => True | S n0 => ex_derive (Derive_n f n0) x end : (R -> R) -> nat -> R_AbsRing -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope _]
is_derive_unique : forall (f : R_AbsRing -> R_NormedModule) (x : R_AbsRing) (l : R_NormedModule), is_derive f x l -> Derive f x = l
AlembertC3_step1 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), x <> 0 -> (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
constant_D_eq = fun (f : R -> R) (D : R -> Prop) (c : R) => forall x : R, D x -> f x = c : (R -> R) -> (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope function_scope R_scope]
Alembert_C3 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
derivable_pt = fun (f : R -> R) (x : R) => {l : R | derivable_pt_abs f x l} : (R -> R) -> R -> Set Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope R_scope]
derivable_pt_abs = fun (f : R -> R) (x l : R) => derivable_pt_lim f x l : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [Rfun_scope R_scope R_scope]
pow_nonzero : forall (x : R) (n : nat), x <> 0 -> x ^ n <> 0
Rinv_pow : forall (x : R) (n : nat), x <> 0 -> / x ^ n = (/ x) ^ n
sum_f_R0 = fix sum_f_R0 (f : nat -> R) (N : nat) {struct N} : R := match N with | 0%nat => f 0%nat | S i => sum_f_R0 f i + f (S i) end : (nat -> R) -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope nat_scope]
pow_RN_plus : forall (x : R) (n m : nat), x <> 0 -> x ^ n = x ^ (n + m) * / x ^ m
Derive = fun (f : R -> R) (x : R) => real (Lim (fun h : R => (f (x + h) - f x) / h) 0) : (R -> R) -> R -> R Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
AlembertC3_step2 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), x = 0 -> {l : R | Pser An x l}
derivable_pt_plus : forall (f1 f2 : R -> R) (x : R), derivable_pt f1 x -> derivable_pt f2 x -> derivable_pt (f1 + f2) x
derivable_pt_mult : forall (f1 f2 : R -> R) (x : R), derivable_pt f1 x -> derivable_pt f2 x -> derivable_pt (f1 * f2) x
sum_eq_R0 : forall (An : nat -> R) (N : nat), (forall n : nat, (n <= N)%nat -> An n = 0) -> sum_f_R0 An N = 0
UniformSpace.sort = fun t : UniformSpace => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : UniformSpace -> Type UniformSpace.sort is a coercion
AbsRing.sort = fun t : AbsRing => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : AbsRing -> Type AbsRing.sort is a coercion
pow_add : forall (x : R) (n m : nat), x ^ (n + m) = x ^ n * x ^ m
ex_derive = fun (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K) (f : K -> V) (x : K) => exists l : V, is_derive f x l : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModule K), (K -> V) -> K -> Prop Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope _]
Pser = fun (An : nat -> R) (x l : R) => infinite_sum (fun n : nat => An n * x ^ n) l : (nat -> R) -> R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0%nat -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
IsStepFun = fun (f : R -> R) (a b : R) => {l : Rlist & is_subdivision f a b l} : (R -> R) -> R -> R -> Type Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope R_scope]

```coq
intros f g n x H.
revert f g x H.
induction n.
- intros. reflexivity.
- intros. simpl. rewrite IHn. apply H.
Qed.
Qed.```

original: intros f g n x H. revert f g x H. induction n. - intros. reflexivity. - intros. simpl. rewrite IHn. apply H.
